CTMC 49020928 1/11/1990 12:00:00 AM Discharge Summary Unsigned DIS Admission Date : 01/11/1990 Unsigned Discharge Date : HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : This is the second Stamgibonnole Hospital admission for this 50 year old woman with a history of hypertension crest syndrome , bilateral DVT , status post MI 1984 , with recurrent angina in 1986 . Catheterization report in 1988 showed subtotal occlusion of the RCA with a high grade LAD lesion . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Significant for as above , hypertension , crest , scleroderma , Reynaud 's , esophagitis , telangectasia and calcinosis . She is status post bilateral DVT 's in 1960's and 1970's , treated with heparin and Coumadin . History of migraine , history of left shoulder bursitis . PAST SURGICAL HISTORY : Status post tubal ligation , appendectomy . Dilt 60 b.i.d. , Lopressor 50 b.i.d. , Motrin 800 t.i.d. decreased from q.i.d. , Zantac prn . Allergies are Morphine causes hives . 1-2 packs per day . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient underwent coronary artery bypass grafting x 2 with bilateral mammary arteries on 1/12/90 . LMA to RCA , LMA to LAD . She was admitted to TNG for blood pressure control . She was extubated on day 1 post-operatively and diuresis was initiated . She continued to do well . On Martin Luther King Day she was noted to be in and out of atrial fibrillation without symptoms . She was continued on Lopressor 50 b.i.d. Her chest tubes were kept in post-operatively due to a large output . The chest tubes were maintained until 1/20/90 , at which time they were pulled sequentially . She was digitalized and due to refractory a-fib on the Lopressor dose and the atrial fibrillation resolved . She is currently in sinus rhythm at a rate of high 70's . DISPOSITION : ________________________________ LW403/3979 RASHANEMAR S. SHINGLES , M.D. FZ5 D : 2254 01/23/90 ELDJOH LARGE , M.D.

D-Dimer > 4000 . ECG : V-paced . CXR : negative . indeterminate . A / P : Will be sent home on same regimen of asa , zestril , lopressor , atorvastatin . Have been following glucoses . Per request of pcp , have changed insulin regimen to 70/30 at 12 units q am . RLL rhonchi , start Levo for ? CAP . 4) Renal . Continue ASA , B-B , ACE-I , statin . 6) Prophylaxis with PPI . Pt reported on discharge that he wants to try to make it at home one last time . Have had long discussions with pt and pcp about this matter and all in agreement . He will receive max home support with AH and home health aide . Pharmacy will be filling meds . Hct bumped but continued to trend down to 27 on day of discharge . Anemia likely secondary to chronic disease , and pt will have Hct checked on Tuesday , August 31st with result faxed to pcp . Pt will be very difficult to maintain at home and will need close supervision by AH and other outpatient support . Results should be faxed to Monaha Jesc at Sade Medical Center at Retelk County Medical Center -- 177-395-9503 . If problem , need to call FLFDMC at 795-648-9919 .
